00001 #ifndef __IMAGE_H
00002 #define __IMAGE_H
00003 
00004 #include "MemMan.h"
00005 #include "imgfmt.h"
00006 
00007 // The HIMAGE module provides a common interface for managing image data. This module
00008 // includes:
00009 // - A set of data structures representing image data. Data can be 8 or 16 bpp and/or
00010 //   compressed
00011 // - A set of file loaders which load specific file formats into the internal data format
00012 // - A set of blitters which blt the data to memory
00013 // - A comprehensive automatic blitter which blits the appropriate type based on the
00014 //   image header.
00015 
00016 
00017 // Defines for type of file readers
00018 #define PCX_FILE_READER                         0x1
00019 #define TGA_FILE_READER                         0x2
00020 #define STCI_FILE_READER                        0x4
00021 #define TRLE_FILE_READER                        0x8
00022 #define UNKNOWN_FILE_READER               0x200
00023 
00024 // Defines for buffer bit depth
00025 #define BUFFER_8BPP                                         0x1
00026 #define BUFFER_16BPP                                  0x2
00027 
00028 // Defines for image charactoristics
00029 #define IMAGE_COMPRESSED                        0x0001
00030 #define IMAGE_TRLECOMPRESSED        0x0002
00031 #define IMAGE_PALETTE                                 0x0004
00032 #define IMAGE_BITMAPDATA                        0x0008
00033 #define IMAGE_APPDATA                                 0x0010
00034 #define IMAGE_ALLIMAGEDATA                0x000C
00035 #define IMAGE_ALLDATA                                 0x001C
00036 
00037 // Palette structure, mimics that of Win32
00038 typedef struct tagSGPPaletteEntry
00039 {  
00040   UINT8 peRed; 
00041   UINT8 peGreen; 
00042   UINT8 peBlue; 
00043   UINT8 peFlags; 
00044 
00045 } SGPPaletteEntry; 
00046 
00047 #define AUX_FULL_TILE                           0x01
00048 #define AUX_ANIMATED_TILE                 0x02
00049 #define AUX_DYNAMIC_TILE                  0x04
00050 #define AUX_INTERACTIVE_TILE  0x08
00051 #define AUX_IGNORES_HEIGHT          0x10
00052 #define AUX_USES_LAND_Z                   0x20

00054 typedef struct
00055 {
00056       UINT8       ubWallOrientation;

00069       INT8        bTileOffsetY;

00071 
00072 // TRLE subimage structure, mirroring that of ST(C)I
00073 typedef struct tagETRLEObject
00074 {     
00075       UINT32                  uiDataOffset;
00076       UINT32                  uiDataLength;
00077       INT16                   sOffsetX;
00078       INT16                   sOffsetY;
00079       UINT16                  usHeight;
00080       UINT16                  usWidth;
00081 } ETRLEObject;
00082 
00083 typedef struct tagETRLEData
00084 {
00085       PTR                                             pPixData;
00086       UINT32                                    uiSizePixData;
00087       ETRLEObject *                 pETRLEObject;
00088       UINT16                                    usNumberOfObjects;
00089 } ETRLEData;
00090 
00091 // Image header structure
00092 typedef struct
00093 {
00094       UINT16                              usWidth;
00095       UINT16                              usHeight;
00096       UINT8                               ubBitDepth;
00097       UINT16                              fFlags;
00098       SGPFILENAME             ImageFile;
00099       UINT32                              iFileLoader;
00100       SGPPaletteEntry *pPalette;
00101       UINT16                              *pui16BPPPalette;
00102       UINT8 *                             pAppData;
00103       UINT32                              uiAppDataSize;
00104       // This union is used to describe each data type and is flexible to include the
00105       // data strucutre of the compresssed format, once developed.
00106       union 
00107       {
00108             struct
00109             {
00110                   PTR         pImageData;
00111             };
00112             struct
00113             {
00114                   PTR         pCompressedImageData;
00115             };
00116             struct 
00117             {
00118                   UINT8                               *p8BPPData;
00119             };
00120             struct
00121             {
00122             
00123                   UINT16 *p16BPPData;
00124             };
00125             struct
00126             {
00127                   UINT8 *                             pPixData8;
00128                   UINT32                              uiSizePixData;
00129                   ETRLEObject *           pETRLEObject;
00130                   UINT16                              usNumberOfObjects;
00131             };
00132       };
00133 
00134 } image_type, *HIMAGE;

00137 #define SGPGetRValue(rgb)   ((BYTE) (rgb))  
00138 #define SGPGetBValue(rgb)   ((BYTE) ((rgb) >> 16))  
00139 #define SGPGetGValue(rgb)   ((BYTE) (((UINT16) (rgb)) >> 8))

00151 // This function will return NULL if it fails, and call SetLastError() to set
00152 // error information
00153 HIMAGE CreateImage( SGPFILENAME ImageFile, UINT16 fContents );
00154 
00155 // This function destroys the HIMAGE structure as well as its contents
00156 BOOLEAN DestroyImage( HIMAGE hImage );
00157 
00158 // This function releases data allocated to various parts of the image based
00159 // on the contents flags passed as a parameter.  If a contents flag is given
00160 // and the image does not contain that data, no error is raised
00161 BOOLEAN ReleaseImageData( HIMAGE hImage, UINT16 fContents );
00162 
00163 // This function will attept to Load data from an existing image object's filename
00164 // In this way, dynamic loading of image data can be done
00165 BOOLEAN LoadImageData( HIMAGE hImage, UINT16 fContents );
00166 
00167 // This function will run the appropriate copy function based on the type of HIMAGE object
00168 BOOLEAN CopyImageToBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, UINT32 fBufferType, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect );
00169 
00170 // The following blitters are used by the function above as well as clients
00171 #ifndef NO_ZLIB_COMPRESSION
00172       BOOLEAN Copy8BPPCompressedImageTo8BPPBuffer( HIMAGE hImage, BYTE *pDestBuf, UINT16 usDestWidth, UINT16 usDestHeight, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *srcRect );
